intro: Pelexia pavonii, commonly known as the rainbow pelexia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that range from red to orange and yellow, which are not true flowers but modified leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other showy flowering plants. Pelexia pavonii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
